As Elizabeth struggles to fight off the spirit's control, she begins to uncover the dark secrets behind the evil spirit. Based on your preferences, I would recommend watching "Inside Out". This animated film tells the story of a young girl named Joy who finds out that her emotions are real and live in a world called Inside Out. The film is visually stunning, featuring colorful animation and memorable characters such as Joy, Sadness, Anger, Fear and Disgust.
I would also recommend watching "Corpse Bride". This animated film tells the story of a young girl named Satsuki who falls into a river while looking for her missing cat. When she comes out of the river, she is greeted by the ghost of her late cat, who promises to make Satsuki happy in return for the soul of her late cat.
I would also recommend watching "Frankenweenie". This animated film tells the story of a young boy named Timmy who is fascinated by the idea of having a real-life pet like his own dog. One day, while Timmy is sitting outside on a sunny day, he suddenly falls into a hole in the ground that he had never noticed before. When Timmy comes out of the hole in the ground, he is greeted by the ghost of his late dog, who promises to make Timmy happy in return for the soul of his late dog.
I would also recommend watching "Coraline". This animated film tells the story of a young girl named Coraline who lives with her parents in a small house on a quiet street in a quiet town in a quiet country. One day, while Coraline is sitting outside on a sunny day, she suddenly falls into a hole in the ground that she had never noticed before. When Coraline comes out of the hole in the ground, she is greeted by the ghost of her late cat, who promises to make Coraline happy in return for the soul of her late cat.
Please note that these are just a few recommendations based on your preferences. There are many other excellent animated films available to watch and enjoy.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Ratatouille" (2007) to you.
This movie tells the story of a rat named Remy who has always dreamed of owning his own restaurant one day. One day, while working as a dishwasher at a local restaurant called La Halle Bruneau in the French-speaking city of Montreal, Quebec, Canada, Remy becomes trapped inside the workings of the restaurant's kitchen appliances, and spends several hours struggling to escape from there.
During this time, a group of young kitchen workers who work at another restaurant called Le Bistro en Rose in the French-speaking city of Nice, France, are busy preparing the menu for that day. The menu includes various types of traditional French cuisine, such as escargot (蜗牛), ratatouille (煮熟的蔬菜), coq au vin (红酒炖鸡) and mafaldine al ragù (慢煮面配肉酱) among others.
As the young kitchen workers are busy preparing the menu for that day, Remy manages to escape from his trapped position inside the workings of the restaurant's kitchen appliances, and makes it back to La Halle Bruneau in time to help one of the other young kitchen workers who works at another restaurant called Le Bistro en Rose in the French-speaking city of Nice, France, become stuck inside one of the other restaurant's kitchen appliances while trying to prepare her own portion of the menu for that day.

Based on the user's preferences and the given movie recommendations, I suggest "Her" as a suitable recommendation.

The movie "Her" is a unique and thought-provoking film that explores the boundaries of love and technology.

The main character, played by Scarlett Johansson, is an artificial intelligence who falls in love with a human named Theodore (played by Jesse Eisenberg)).

As the main character learns about the limitations and complexities of love and technology, she must navigate these challenges while also trying to maintain her connection with Theodore.

Overall, "Her" is a thought-provoking and engaging film that explores the boundaries of love and technology.
